subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Loneliness of Leadership
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Loneliness of Leadership usable.

hook.text: Ben Horowitz wrote that as CEO, he had nobody to talk to. Every conversation had consequences.

buildup.text: Founder loneliness isn't about being alone. It's about having nobody who fully understands your reality.

discovery.text: A Harvard study found CEO loneliness directly correlates with poor decisions and lower performance.

twist.text: You can't vent to employees, investors, or customers. Each group sees a filtered version of you.

climax.text: YC founder Paul Graham started office hours because he knew founders needed someone who truly understood.

punchline.text: Leadership is crowded at the bottom, empty at the top.

quiz.question: Why do founders experience loneliness even when surrounded by people?
options: They can't fully confide in employees, investors, or customers without consequences
They work too many hours to maintain friendships
